issues.issue_title: Expand this post links are broken
issues.issue_body: ### Steps to reproduce the problem Click on a photo in the Gallery: https://chaos.social/@karotte/media The link for "expand this post" contains undefined rather than the username: Clicking on the link loads the correct post, but the URL in the address bar is incorrect. Opening the link in a new tab doesn't work since the username is undefined. ### Expected behaviour "Expand this post" link should contain username ### Actual behaviour "Expand this post" link contains undefined where the username should be ### Detailed description _No response_ ### Mastodon instance chaos.social ### Mastodon version v4.4.1 ### Browser name and version Firefox 139.0.1 ### Operating system Arch Linux ### Technical details _No response_

commit.commit_title: Add restrictions on which quote posts can trend (#35507)

prs.pr_title: Add restrictions on which quote posts can trend
prs.pr_body:
This changes the trending behavior to only allow quote posts to trend if:
- the quoted post is resolvable and accepted
- the quoted post has opted into trending
- the quoted post is not sensitive content

This is similar to the original rules for trending posts, although:
- it allows the quoted post to be a reply (the rationale is that many quoted posts will be, and the quote post will provide context)
- it allows the quoted post to have an invalid language (the rationale for that is that the quoted post still has language restrictions and could be quoting from another language, providing a translation or sufficient context)
- it allows the quoted post to itself quote anything (this is partly for technical reasons, partly because those nested quotes are not directly displayed, and thus akin to a mention or a link)

commit.commit_title: Fix synchronous recursive fetching of deeply-nested quoted posts (#35600)

prs.pr_title: Fix synchronous recursive fetching of deeply-nested quoted posts
prs.pr_body:
Fixes #35572

Like other resources, quote posts can be recursively fetched, and the depth is limited through the `request_id` mechanism.

However, unlike other resources, they are fetched synchronously, which is required for a good user experience, but drastically changes the nature of the recursion, and the global asynchronous recursion limit we use is far too high for synchronous recursion.

This commit introduces a synchronous recursion depth limit to only fetch a maximum of 2 nested quotes synchronously, leaving the rest to later jobs.

issues.issue_title: Fetching deeply-nested quote posts crashes with `SystemStackError`
issues.issue_body:
### Steps to reproduce the problem

Primary Issue: Paperclip Image Processing Loop
```
lib/paperclip/vips_lazy_thumbnail.rb:100:in 'Paperclip::LazyThumbnail#transformed_image'
lib/paperclip/vips_lazy_thumbnail.rb:68:in 'Paperclip::LazyThumbnail#make'
app/models/concerns/remotable.rb:27:in 'MediaAttachment#remotable_attachment'
```

Secondary Issue: ActivityPub Quote Processing Loop
```
app/lib/activitypub/activity/create.rb:209:in 'ActivityPub::Activity::Create#attach_quote'
app/services/activitypub/verify_quote_service.rb:12:in 'ActivityPub::VerifyQuoteService#call'
app/services/activitypub/fetch_remote_status_service.rb:55:in 'ActivityPub::FetchRemoteStatusService#call'
app/lib/activitypub/activity/create.rb:25:in 'ActivityPub::Activity::Create#create_status'
```

Crash: Last line in log
```
INFO -- : Command :: ffmpeg -nostdin -ss '0' -i '/tmp/58feccb35433f95717b3489986244cc920250727-7-h6ck47.mp4' -loglevel 'fatal' -vf 'scale='\''min(640\, iw):min(640\, ih)'\'':force_original_aspect_ratio=decrease' -f 'image2' -vframes '1' -y '/tmp/58feccb35433f95717b3489986244cc920250727-7-h6ck4720250727-7-52n6sj.png'
```

### Expected behaviour

Fail or Process

### Actual behaviour

Recursion loop

### Detailed description

The following error caused a loop on Sidekiq:
```
WARN: SystemStackError: stack level too deep
WARN: lib/paperclip/vips_lazy_thumbnail.rb:100:in 'Paperclip::LazyThumbnail#transformed_image'
lib/paperclip/vips_lazy_thumbnail.rb:68:in 'Paperclip::LazyThumbnail#make'
lib/paperclip/attachment_extensions.rb:21:in 'block in Paperclip::AttachmentExtensions#post_process_style'
lib/paperclip/attachment_extensions.rb:20:in 'Array#each'
lib/paperclip/attachment_extensions.rb:20:in 'Enumerable#inject'
lib/paperclip/attachment_extensions.rb:20:in 'Paperclip::AttachmentExtensions#post_process_style'
app/models/concerns/remotable.rb:27:in 'Kernel#public_send'
app/models/concerns/remotable.rb:27:in 'block (2 levels) in MediaAttachment#remotable_attachment'
app/lib/request.rb:122:in 'Request#perform'
app/models/concerns/remotable.rb:24:in 'block in MediaAttachment#remotable_attachment'
app/lib/activitypub/activity/create.rb:304:in 'block in ActivityPub::Activity::Create#process_attachments'
app/lib/activitypub/activity/create.rb:285:in 'Array#each'
app/lib/activitypub/activity/create.rb:285:in 'ActivityPub::Activity::Create#process_attachments'
app/lib/activitypub/activity/create.rb:93:in 'ActivityPub::Activity::Create#process_status_params'
app/lib/activitypub/activity/create.rb:51:in 'ActivityPub::Activity::Create#process_status'
app/lib/activitypub/activity/create.rb:25:in 'block in ActivityPub::Activity::Create#create_status'
app/models/concerns/lockable.rb:12:in 'block (2 levels) in Lockable#with_redis_lock'
app/models/concerns/lockable.rb:10:in 'block in Lockable#with_redis_lock'
```
After that, I see the following lines repeating many, many times:
```
app/lib/redis_connection.rb:10:in 'RedisConnection.with'
app/models/concerns/redisable.rb:9:in 'Redisable#with_redis'
app/models/concerns/lockable.rb:9:in 'Lockable#with_redis_lock'
app/lib/activitypub/activity/create.rb:19:in 'ActivityPub::Activity::Create#create_status'
app/lib/activitypub/activity/create.rb:11:in 'ActivityPub::Activity::Create#perform'
app/services/activitypub/fetch_remote_status_service.rb:55:in 'ActivityPub::FetchRemoteStatusService#call'
app/services/activitypub/verify_quote_service.rb:75:in 'ActivityPub::VerifyQuoteService#fetch_quoted_post_if_needed!'
app/services/activitypub/verify_quote_service.rb:12:in 'ActivityPub::VerifyQuoteService#call'
app/lib/activitypub/activity/create.rb:209:in 'ActivityPub::Activity::Create#attach_quote'
app/lib/activitypub/activity/create.rb:61:in 'block in ActivityPub::Activity::Create#process_status'
app/lib/activitypub/activity/create.rb:56:in 'ActivityPub::Activity::Create#process_status'
app/lib/activitypub/activity/create.rb:25:in 'block in ActivityPub::Activity::Create#create_status'
app/models/concerns/lockable.rb:12:in 'block (2 levels) in Lockable#with_redis_lock'
app/models/concerns/lockable.rb:10:in 'block in Lockable#with_redis_lock'
```
Until it ends all processing after:
```
app/lib/activitypub/activity/announce.rb:8:in 'ActivityPub::Activity::Announce#perform'
app/services/activitypub/process_collection_service.rb:69:in 'ActivityPub::ProcessCollectionService#process_item'
app/services/activitypub/process_collection_service.rb:60:in 'block in ActivityPub::ProcessCollectionService#process_items'
app/services/activitypub/process_collection_service.rb:60:in 'Array#reverse_each'
app/services/activitypub/process_collection_service.rb:60:in 'Enumerator#each'
app/services/activitypub/process_collection_service.rb:60:in 'Enumerable#filter_map'
app/services/activitypub/process_collection_service.rb:60:in 'ActivityPub::ProcessCollectionService#process_items'
app/services/activitypub/process_collection_service.rb:39:in 'ActivityPub::ProcessCollectionService#call'
app/workers/activitypub/processing_worker.rb:16:in 'ActivityPub::ProcessingWorker#perform'
lib/mastodon/sidekiq_middleware.rb:8:in 'block in Mastodon::SidekiqMiddleware#call'
lib/mastodon/sidekiq_middleware.rb:73:in 'Mastodon::SidekiqMiddleware#setup_query_log_tags'
lib/mastodon/sidekiq_middleware.rb:7:in 'Mastodon::SidekiqMiddleware#call'
2025-07-27T07:45:22.705Z pid=7 tid=2gzdmv class=ActivityPub::ProcessingWorker jid=adb2a983f93f96ff84bb7023 INFO: start
2025-07-27T07:45:22.928Z pid=7 tid=2gzx9b class=LinkCrawlWorker jid=1a737b3dce815b54ecec3c6f INFO: start
...
2025-07-27T07:45:23.188Z pid=7 tid=2gzdmv class=ActivityPub::ProcessingWorker jid=adb2a983f93f96ff84bb7023 elapsed=0.483 INFO: done
...
I, [2025-07-27T07:45:23.414090 #7]  INFO -- : [paperclip] Trying to link /tmp/c76621e9870a0303da80223ab0f5a83220250727-7-g7heym.getB to /tmp/88f52d3b5a7debc0081549063a6a936b20250727-7-d12qh4.mp4
I, [2025-07-27T07:45:23.414371 #7]  INFO -- : Command :: file -b --mime '/tmp/88f52d3b5a7debc0081549063a6a936b20250727-7-d12qh4.mp4'
2025-07-27T07:45:23.481Z pid=7 tid=2h3v6f class=ActivityPub::ProcessingWorker jid=8f8afe6cd962623f89889283 INFO: start
I, [2025-07-27T07:45:23.510573 #7]  INFO -- : Command :: ffmpeg -nostdin -i '/tmp/c76621e9870a0303da80223ab0f5a83220250727-7-g7heym.getB' -loglevel 'fatal' -map_metadata '-1' -movflags 'faststart' -c:v 'copy' -c:a 'copy' -y '/tmp/c76621e9870a0303da80223ab0f5a83220250727-7-g7heym20250727-7-wams65.mp4'
I, [2025-07-27T07:45:23.539914 #7]  INFO -- : [paperclip] Trying to link /tmp/c76621e9870a0303da80223ab0f5a83220250727-7-g7heym20250727-7-wams65.mp4 to /tmp/58feccb35433f95717b3489986244cc920250727-7-h6ck47.mp4
2025-07-27T07:45:23.546Z pid=7 tid=2h3v6f class=ActivityPub::ProcessingWorker jid=8f8afe6cd962623f89889283 elapsed=0.065 INFO: done
I, [2025-07-27T07:45:23.558106 #7]  INFO -- : Command :: ffmpeg -nostdin -ss '0' -i '/tmp/58feccb35433f95717b3489986244cc920250727-7-h6ck47.mp4' -loglevel 'fatal' -vf 'scale='\''min(640\, iw):min(640\, ih)'\'':force_original_aspect_ratio=decrease' -f 'image2' -vframes '1' -y '/tmp/58feccb35433f95717b3489986244cc920250727-7-h6ck4720250727-7-52n6sj.png'
```

I believe the `Paperclip::LazyThumbnail` error is related to VIPS and likely the source of Sidekiq getting stuck randomly, starting with version 4.3.0 and VIPS. I have noticed this in more than one instance.

Not sure if the fact that those instances use OpenStack Swift for object storage is related, but it's not a problem for all instances using OpenStack Swift, or at least it has only impacted a small number of those.

### Mastodon instance

Multiple

### Mastodon version

v4.4.2

### Technical details

- VIPS enabled
- OpenStack Swift Object Storage

commit.commit_title: Fix WebUI crashing for accounts with `null` URL (#35651)

prs.pr_title: Fix WebUI crashing for accounts with `null` URL
prs.pr_body:
Fixes #35635

In 79931bf3ae4, we at the same time added JS code that relied on `url` never to be `null`, and introduced a new way for `url` to be `null`. This PR changes it to consider the `url` field in the API response to be potentially `null`, according to the specifications, and also provides a server-side fallback in line with what we used to have before 79931bf3ae4 so that other clients are less likely to run into the same issue.

issues.issue_title: Browser stays blank after login; Console error: "Uncaught TypeError: can't access property "startsWith", n.url is null"
issues.issue_body:
### Steps to reproduce the problem

- Login to affected account.



### Expected behaviour

Redirect to %domain%/deck/getting-started

### Actual behaviour

URL in url-bar stayed at %domain% and the browser window went (dark mode) black/grey.

### Detailed description

Observed after upgrade to 4.4.2 not sure whether this was an issue before.

Error found in Browser Console:

```
Uncaught TypeError: can't access property "startsWith", n.url is null
    wI account.ts:150
    bI accounts.ts:23
    OI accounts.ts:37
    OI accounts.ts:36
    CI accounts.ts:59
    Immutable 4
    Redux 2
    QM sounds.ts:83
    HM errors.ts:53
    WM loading_bar.ts:84
    Redux 2
    ck store.js:25
    om Redux
    <anonymous> mastodon.jsx:27
useSelectableClick-C-trR-q9.js:40:7809
    wI account.ts:150
    bI accounts.ts:23
    OI accounts.ts:37
    forEach self-hosted:157
    OI accounts.ts:36
    CI accounts.ts:59
    default Immutable
    forEach self-hosted:157
    Immutable 3
    Redux 2
    QM sounds.ts:83
    HM errors.ts:53
    WM loading_bar.ts:84
    Redux 2
    ck store.js:25
    om Redux
    <anonym> mastodon.jsx:27
```

Looking into the database I found that the url column in the accounts table of the affected account was null.

Setting it to %domain%/%accountname% (e.g., https://example.com/foobar) resolved the issue.

### Mastodon instance

https://xtux.org/

### Mastodon version

v4.4.2

### Browser name and version

Librewolf 141.0-1 and Version 138.0.7204.157 (Offizieller Build) snap (64-Bit)

### Operating system

Ubuntu 22.04.5 LTS

### Technical details

_No response_

commit.commit_title: Avoid nested transactions when fetching quote posts (#35657)

commit.commit_title: Disable ActiveRecord query cache in `Create` critical path (#35662)

prs.pr_title: Disable ActiveRecord query cache in `Create` critical path
prs.pr_body:
Call sites regularly check for the status existing before going into `Create`. When that happens, the critical section is useless as ActiveRecord will fail to find the status, because of the cached negative result.

I believe this will fix the occasional `Validation failed: Uri has already been taken` issues we've been seeing.

New Crowdin translations, automated with GitHub Actions

See `.github/workflows/crowdin-download.yml`

This PR will be updated every day with new translations.

Due to a limitation in GitHub Actions, checks are not running on this PR without manual action.
If you want to run the checks, then close and re-open it.
